suggestions.title: What Is Dengue Fever? Symptoms, Causes, Diagnosis, Treatment, and Prevention
suggestions.description: This mosquito-borne viral infection is becoming more common worldwide.

suggestions.title: Should You Feed a Cold and Starve a Fever?
suggestions.description: Though the saying "feed a cold and starve a fever" is commonly heard, science shows there are plenty of reasons not to follow that advice.

suggestions.title: Why Do We Feel Cold  When We Have a Fever?
suggestions.description: Having a fever and the chills at the same time may seem bizarre, but it's actually a sign that your body is doing its best to fight off an infection.

suggestions.title: What Is Chikungunya? Symptoms, Causes, Diagnosis, Treatment, and Prevention
suggestions.description: Chikungunya is a viral disease transmitted to humans by infected mosquitoes. It is characterized by sudden fever and joint pain that can be severe and debilitating.

suggestions.title: What Is Salmonella? Symptoms, Causes, Diagnosis, Treatment, and Prevention
suggestions.description: Foodborne salmonella infections cause diarrhea and other symptoms that typically resolve on their own. Symptoms include fever, headache, nausea, and more.

suggestions.title: What Is Eczema (Atopic Dermatitis)? Symptoms, Causes, Diagnosis, Treatment, Prevention
suggestions.description: Eczema or atopic dermatitis is a condition that causes skin to become itchy, red, scaly, and inflamed. Eczema is linked to hay fever and asthma. About 13 percent of U.S. kids and 10.2 percent of U.S. adults has it. Learn more in this scientific article.

suggestions.title: The Facts on Flu Vaccine Side Effects and Risks
suggestions.description: The flu shot can make your arm sore and cause a low-grade fever. Very rarely, people who get the shot develop Guillain-Barr√© syndrome (GBS).

suggestions.title: From Nose to Toes, the List of COVID-19 Symptoms Keeps Growing
suggestions.description: Health experts have expanded the list of coronavirus symptoms beyond dry cough, fever, and shortness of breath to include runny nose or congestion, nausea or vomiting, and diarrhea.

suggestions.title: 6 Unusual Signs of Dehydration You Should Know About
suggestions.description: Chronic dehydration can lead to fever, fatigue, bad mood, cravings for sweets, and headache. Learn about some unusual dehydration symptoms and how to stay hydrated.

suggestions.title: 11 Fascinating Facts About Body Temperature
suggestions.description: Your body temperature can reveal a lot about you and your health. Learn more about fevers, low temps, and more.
